    "| **Broad Question** | **Refined, Data-Driven Question** |\n",

    "| Who engages with election fraud claims? | What percentage of election fraud misinformation engagement comes from bot accounts vs. real users? |\n",
    "| How effective is climate fact-checking? | What is the engagement difference between climate misinformation posts and their fact-checked corrections? |\n",

    "✔ **Keep it aligned with available data sources** (e.g., social media datasets, fact-checking databases).  \n",
    "\n",

    "**Step 3: Find Relevant Data Sources**  \n",
    "Once you have your research questions, identify **at least one dataset** that contains the necessary information.  \n",

    "**📌 Common Data Sources for Misinformation Analysis:**  \n",
    "\n",
    "| **Research Question** | **Best Data Sources** |\n",
    "|----------------------|----------------------|\n",
    "| Who were the top spreaders of misinformation? | Twitter API, Facebook Ad Library, Reddit API |\n",
    "| How did engagement with misinformation compare to fact-checks? | Fact-checking databases (Snopes, PolitiFact, Google Fact Check API) |\n",
    "| Did misinformation engagement peak at specific moments? | Social media APIs (Twitter, YouTube), Google Trends |\n",
    "| What role did bots play in spreading misinformation? | Bot detection tools (Botometer, Twitter API) |\n",
    "\n",
    "✍️ **List at least one dataset that aligns with your research questions.**  \n",

    "\n",
    "| **Evaluation Factor** | **Key Questions** |\n",
    "|----------------------|------------------|\n",
    "| **Source Reliability** | Who collected this data? Is the source reputable (e.g., research institution, fact-checking organization, government agency)? |\n",
    "| **Data Accuracy & Completeness** | Does the dataset include necessary details (timestamps, user interactions, context)? Are there missing values? |\n",
    "| **Bias & Manipulation Risks** | Could there be selection or algorithmic bias? Were data collection methods transparent? |\n",
    "| **Freshness & Context** | Is the dataset recent and relevant to your misinformation topic? Does it cover the full scope of the event? |\n",
